Problem:
class ShoppingCart { constructor() { this.items = []; this.total = 0; } addItem(item) { this.items.push(item); if (item.onSale) { this.total += item.price * 0.8; } else { this.total += item.price; } } removeItem(itemIndex) { const item = this.items[itemIndex]; if (item) { this.total -= item.onSale ? item.price * 0.8 : item.price; this.items.splice(itemIndex, 1); } } }",

If the total increases when an item is added, does it imply that the added item's price was high?
Explanation: An increase in total just indicates that an item was added, but it does not necessarily mean the item's price was high. The item could also be on sale which affects the additional total differently due to the discount factor applied in addItem method.
